conclusion: Determine the time it takes for the rod to reach the top of the cylinder A.
The rod is released from rest and falls freely under gravity. The distance from the suspension point to the top of the cylinder A is 20 m.
Using the kinematic equation for free fall: s = 1/2 g t^2 where s = 20 m and g = 10 m/s^2.
Determine the time it takes for the rod to pass through the cylinder.
The rod is 5 m long, and it needs to pass through the cylinder, which is also 5 m tall.
The rod will start passing through the cylinder when its lower end reaches the top of the cylinder A, and it will finish passing through when its upper end reaches the bottom of the cylinder B.
The total distance the rod travels to pass through the cylinder is 5 m (the length of the rod).
Using the same kinematic equation: s = 1/2 g t^2 where s = 5 m and g = 10 m/s^2.
Calculate the total time t_1 for the rod to pass through the cylinder: t_1 = 2 s + 1 s = 3 s.
The time t_1 it takes for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end A of the cylinder is 3 s.
